apiError.description: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed

badWordsList.description: Array of the bad words found

badWordsTotal.description: Total number of bad words detected

censoredContent.description: The censored content (only set if censor-character has been set)

isBad.description: Does the text contain bad words

cardBrand.description: The card brand (e.g. Visa or Mastercard)

cardType.description: The card type, will always be one of: DEBIT, CREDIT, CHARGE CARD

country.description: Full country name of the issuer

countryCode.description: ISO 2-letter country code of the issuer

ipBlocklisted.description: True if the customer IP is listed on one of our blocklists, see the IP Blocklist API for more details

ipBlocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklists this IP is listed on

ipCity.description: The city name (if detectable) from the customer IP

ipCountry.description: The country detected from the customer IP

ipCountryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code detected from the customer IP

ipMatchesBin.description: True if the customer IP address country matches the BIN country

ipRegion.description: The region name (if detectable) from the customer IP

issuerPhone.description: The card issuer phone number (if known)

valid.description: Is this a valid BIN or IIN number

isListed.description: true if listed, false if not

listRating.description: the list rating [1-3] with 1 being the best rating and 3 the lowest rating

responseTime.description: the DNSBL server response time in milliseconds

txtRecord.description: the TXT record returned for this listing (if listed)

fromType.description: The type of the value being converted from

valid.description: Was the coversion successful and produced a valid result

domainError.description: True if this address has a domain error (e.g. no valid mail server records)

email.description: The full email address (this could be different to the supplied address if fix-typos is used)

isDisposable.description: True if this address is a disposable, temporary or darknet related email address

isFreemail.description: True if this address is a free-mail address

syntaxError.description: True if this address has a syntax error

typosFixed.description: True if typos have been fixed

found.description: The number of possible matching locations found

addressComponents.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state etc. May also include additional metadata about the address

countryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

found.description: True if these coordinates map to a real location

postalCode.description: The postal code for the location

hlrStatus.description: The HLR lookup status. See API docs for specific status details

hlrValid.description: Was the HLR lookup successful. If true then this is a working and registered cell-phone or mobile device (SMS and phone calls will be delivered)

imsi.description: The mobile IMSI number (only set if HLR lookup valid)

isPorted.description: Has this number been ported to another network

isRoaming.description: Is this number currently roaming from its origin country

location.description: Number location (could be a city, region or country)

mcc.description: The mobile MCC number (only set if HLR lookup valid)

mnc.description: The mobile MNC number (only set if HLR lookup valid)

msin.description: The mobile MSIN number (only set if HLR lookup valid)

numberType.description: The number type, possible values are: mobile, fixed-line, premium-rate, toll-free, voip, unknown

numberValid.description: Is this a valid phone number (mobile or otherwise)

originNetwork.description: The origin mobile carrier name (only set if HLR lookup valid)

portedNetwork.description: If the number has been ported, the ported to mobile carrier name (only set if HLR lookup valid)

listCount.description: The number of DNSBL's the host is listed on

lists.description: An array of objects for each DNSBL checked

total.description: The total number of values extracted

isBot.description: IP is hosting a malicious bot or is part of a botnet

isDshield.description: IP has been flagged on DShield (dshield.org)

isExploitBot.description: IP is hosting an exploit finding bot or exploit scanning software

isHijacked.description: hijacked netblocks or netblocks controlled by criminal organizations

isListed.description: Is this IP on a blocklist

isMalware.description: IP is involved in distributing malware

isProxy.description: IP has been detected as an anonymous web proxy or anonymous HTTP proxy

isSpamBot.description: IP address is hosting a spam bot, comment spamming or other spamming software

isSpider.description: IP is a hostile spider or crawler

isSpyware.description: IP is being used by spyware, malware, botnets or for other malicious activities

isTor.description: IP is coming from a Tor node

isVpn.description: IP has been detected as coming from a VPN hosting provider

lastSeen.description: The last time this IP was seen on a blocklist (in Unix time or 0 if not listed recently)

listCount.description: The number of blocklists the IP is listed on

hostname.description: The IPs hostname (only set if reverse-lookup has been used)

valid.description: Is this a valid IP address

provider-description.description: A description of the provider, usually extracted from the providers website or WHOIS record

provider-domain.description: The domain name of the provider

provider-type.description: The detected provider type. See API docs for specific provider type details

provider-website.description: The website URL for the provider

valid.description: Is this a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

addressComponents.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state etc. May also include additional metadata about the address

countryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

postalCode.description: The postal code for the location

state.description: The state of the location (if applicable)

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

number-valid.description: Is this a valid phone number

location.description: Number location (could be a city, region or country)

type.description: The number type, possible values are: mobile, fixed-line, premium-rate, toll-free, voip, unknown

valid.description: Is this a valid phone number

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

numberValid.description: Is this a valid phone number

securityCode.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

numberValid.description: Is this a valid phone number

securityCode.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

sent.description: True if the SMS has been sent

content.description: The actual content this URL responded with. Only set if the 'fetch-content' option was used

contentEncoding.description: The encoding type the URL uses

contentSize.description: The size of the URL content in bytes

contentType.description: The content-type the URL points to

httpOk.description: True if this URL responded with an HTTP OK (200) status

httpRedirect.description: True if this URL responded with a HTTP redirect

httpStatus.description: The HTTP status code this URL responded with

httpStatusMessage.description: The HTTP status message assoicated with the status code

loadTime.description: The time taken to load the URL content (in seconds)

query.description: A key:value map of the URL query paramaters

real.description: Is this URL actually serving real content

serverCity.description: Server IP geo-location: full city name (if detectable)

serverCountry.description: Server IP geo-location: full country name

serverCountryCode.description: Server IP geo-location: ISO 2-letter country code

serverIp.description: The IP address of the server hosting this URL

serverName.description: The name of the server software hosting this URL

serverRegion.description: Server IP geo-location: full region name (if detectable)

url.description: The fully qualified URL. This may be different to the URL requested if http-redirect is True

urlProtocol.description: The URL protocol (usually http or https)

valid.description: Is this a valid well-formed URL

isAndroid.description: True if this is an Android based mobile user agent

isIos.description: True if this is an iOS based mobile user agent

isMobile.description: True if this is a mobile user-agent

operatingSystemFamily.description: The operating system family name, this is the OS name without any version information

operatingSystemVersion.description: The operating system version number (if detectable)

type.description: The user-agent type, possible values are: desktop-browser, email-client, feed-reader, software-library, media-player, mobile-browser, robot, unknown

verified.description: True if the code is valid

actions.title: bad_word_filter.post
actions.description: Detect bad words, swear words and profanity in a given text

content.description: The text content to check. This can be either a URL to load content from or an actual content string

censor-character.description: The character to use to censor out the bad words found

actions.title: bin_lookup.post
actions.description: Perform a BIN (Bank Identification Number) or IIN (Issuer Identification Number) lookup. See: https://www.neutrinoapi.com/api/bin-lookup/

bin-number.description: The BIN or IIN number (the first 6 digits of a credit card number)

customer-ip.description: Pass in a customers remote IP address. The API will then determine the country of the IP address and match it against the BIN country. This feature is designed for fraud prevention and detection checks.

actions.title: code_highlight.post
actions.description: Code highlight will take raw source code and convert into nicely formatted HTML with syntax and keyword highlighting

content.description: The source content. This can be either a URL to load from or an actual content string

type.description: The code type. See the API docs for all supported types

add-keyword-links.description: Add links on source code keywords to the relevant language documentation

actions.title: Convert
actions.description: A powerful unit and currency conversion tool

from-type.description: The type of the value to convert from

actions.title: email_validate.post
actions.description: Parse, validate and clean an email address

fix-typos.description: Automatically attempt to fix typos in the address

actions.title: geocode_address.post
actions.description: Geocode an address, partial address or the name of a location

address.description: The address or partial address to try and locate

country-code.description: The ISO 2-letter country code to be biased towards (default is no country bias)

language-code.description: The language to display results in, available languages are: de, en, es, fr, it, pt, ru

fuzzy-search.description: If no matches are found for the given address, start performing a recursive fuzzy search until a geolocation is found. We use a combination of approximate string matching and data cleansing to find possible location matches

actions.title: geocode_reverse.post
actions.description: Convert a geographic coordinate (latitude and longitude) into a real world address or location.

language-code.description: The language to display results in, available languages are: de, en, es, fr, it, pt, ru

actions.title: hlr_lookup.post
actions.description: Connect to the global mobile cellular network and retrieve the status of a mobile device

country-code.description: ISO 2-letter country code, assume numbers are based in this country. If not set numbers are assumed to be in international format (with or without the leading + sign)

actions.title: host_reputation.post
actions.description: Check the reputation of an IP address or domain against a comprehensive list of blacklists and blocklists (DNSBLs)

host.description: An IPv4 address or a domain name. If you supply a domain name it will be checked against the URI DNSBL list

actions.title: html_clean.post
actions.description: Clean and sanitize untrusted HTML

content.description: The HTML content. This can be either a URL to load HTML from or an actual HTML content string

output-type.description: The level of sanitization, possible values are: plain-text, simple-text, basic-html, basic-html-with-images, advanced-html

actions.title: html_extract_tags.post
actions.description: Extract specific HTML tag contents or attributes from complex HTML or XHTML content

content.description: The HTML content. This can be either a URL to load HTML from or an actual HTML content string

tag.description: The HTML tag(s) to extract data from. This can just be a simple tag name like 'img' OR a CSS/jQuery style selector

attribute.description: If set, then extract data from the specified tag attribute. If not set, then data will be extracted from the tags inner content

base-url.description: The base URL to replace into realive links

actions.title: html5_render.post
actions.description: Render HTML and HTML5 content to PDF, JPG or PNG

content.description: The HTML content. This can be either a URL to load HTML from or an actual HTML content string

format.description: Which format to output, available options are: PDF, PNG, JPG

page-size.description: Set the document page size, can be one of: A0 - A9, B0 - B10, Comm10E, DLE or Letter

landscape.description: Set the document to lanscape orientation

zoom.description: Set the zoom factor when rendering the page (2.0 for double size, 0.5 for half size)

grayscale.description: Render the final document in grayscale

media-print.description: Use @media print CSS styles to render the document

media-queries.description: Activate all @media queries before rendering. This can be useful if you wan't to render the mobile version of a responsive website

forms.description: Generate real (fillable) PDF forms from HTML forms

css.description: Inject custom CSS into the HTML. e.g. 'body { background-color: red;}'

image-width.description: If rendering to an image format (PNG or JPG) use this image width (in pixels)

image-height.description: If rendering to an image format (PNG or JPG) use this image height (in pixels). The default is automatic which dynamically sets the image height based on the content

actions.title: image_resize.post
actions.description: Resize an image and output as either JPEG or PNG. See: https://www.neutrinoapi.com/api/image-resize/

image-url.description: The URL to the source image

format.description: The output image format, can be either png or jpg

actions.title: image_watermark.post
actions.description: Watermark one image with another image. See: https://www.neutrinoapi.com/api/image-watermark/

image-url.description: The URL to the source image

watermark-url.description: The URL to the watermark image

opacity.description: The opacity of the watermark (0 to 100)

format.description: The output image format, can be either png or jpg

position.description: The position of the watermark image, possible values are: center, top-left, top-center, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right

width.description: If set resize the resulting image to this width (preserving aspect ratio)

height.description: If set resize the resulting image to this height (preserving aspect ratio)

actions.title: ip_blocklist.post
actions.description: The IP Blocklist API will detect potentially malicious or dangerous IP addresses

actions.title: ip_info.post
actions.description: Get location information about an IP address and do reverse DNS (PTR) lookups.

reverse-lookup.description: Do a reverse DNS (PTR) lookup. This option can add extra delay to the request so only use it if you need it

actions.title: ip_probe.post
actions.description: Analyze and extract provider information for an IP address

actions.title: phone_playback.post
actions.description: Make an automated call to any valid phone number and playback an audio message

number.description: The phone number to call. Must be valid international format

audio-url.description: A URL to a valid audio file. Accepted audio formats are: MP3, WAV, OGG

actions.title: phone_validate.post
actions.description: Parse, validate and get location information about a phone number

country-code.description: ISO 2-letter country code, assume numbers are based in this country. If not set numbers are assumed to be in international format (with or without the leading + sign)

ip.description: Pass in a users IP address and we will assume numbers are based in the country of the IP address

actions.title: phone_verify.post
actions.description: Make an automated call to any valid phone number and playback a unique security code

number.description: The phone number to send the verification code to

code-length.description: The number of digits to use in the security code (between 4 and 12)

security-code.description: Pass in your own security code. This is useful if you have implemented TOTP or similar 2FA methods. If not set then we will generate a secure random code (only numerical security codes are currently supported)

playback-delay.description: The delay in milliseconds between the playback of each security code

country-code.description: ISO 2-letter country code, assume numbers are based in this country. If not set numbers are assumed to be in international format (with or without the leading + sign)

language-code.description: The language to playback the verification code in, available languages are: de - German, en - English, es - Spanish, fr - Fench, it - Italian, pt - Portuguese, ru - Russian

actions.title: qr_code.post
actions.description: Generate a QR code as a PNG image. See: https://www.neutrinoapi.com/api/qr-code/

content.description: The content to encode into the QR code (e.g. a URL or a phone number)

width.description: The width of the QR code (in px)

height.description: The height of the QR code (in px)

fg-color.description: The QR code foreground color (you should always use a dark color for this)

bg-color.description: The QR code background color (you should always use a light color for this)

actions.title: sms_verify.post
actions.description: Send a unique security code to any mobile device via SMS

number.description: The phone number to send a verification code to

code-length.description: The number of digits to use in the security code (must be between 4 and 12)

security-code.description: ass in your own security code. This is useful if you have implemented TOTP or similar 2FA methods. If not set then we will generate a secure random code (only numerical security codes are currently supported)

country-code.description: ISO 2-letter country code, assume numbers are based in this country. If not set numbers are assumed to be in international format (with or without the leading + sign)

language-code.description: The language to send the verification code in, available languages are: de - German, en - English, es - Spanish, fr - Fench, it - Italian, pt - Portuguese, ru - Russian

actions.title: url_info.post
actions.description: Parse, analyze and retrieve content from the supplied URL

fetch-content.description: If this URL responds with html, text, json or xml then return the response. This option is useful if you want to perform further processing on the URL content

actions.title: user_agent_info.post
actions.description: Parse, validate and get detailed user-agent information from a user agent string

actions.title: verify_security_code.post
actions.description: Check if a security code from one of the verify APIs is valid
